name: CreateGithubRelease
description:
Creates a new release in a specified GitHub repository.

This tool allows users with push access to create a release in a specified GitHub repository. It triggers notifications and may be subject to rate limiting. Use this tool when you need to publish a new version or release of your software on GitHub.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the repository on GitHub. This name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: tag_name_for_release
parameters.description: The name of the tag for the release. This is used to label the GitHub release.

value_schema.description: The name of the tag.

parameters.name: release_body_text
parameters.description: Text describing the contents of the tag. This is the message or notes for the release, providing context or details about changes.

value_schema.description: Text describing the contents of the tag.

parameters.name: set_latest_release
parameters.description: Set whether this release should be the latest. Use 'true', 'false', or 'legacy'. Drafts and prereleases cannot be set as latest.

value_schema.description: Specifies whether this release should be set as the latest release for the repository. Drafts and prereleases cannot be set as latest. Defaults to `true` for newly published releases. `legacy` specifies that the latest release should be determined based on the release creation date and higher semantic version.

parameters.name: release_name
parameters.description: The name of the release. This identifies the release and can be a version or descriptive text.

value_schema.description: The name of the release.

parameters.name: commit_reference
parameters.description: The branch or commit SHA from which the Git tag is created. Defaults to the repo's default branch.

value_schema.description: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Can be any branch or commit SHA. Unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: the repository's default branch (usually `master`).

parameters.name: draft
parameters.description: Set to `true` for a draft (unpublished) release, or `false` for a published one.

value_schema.description: `true` to create a draft (unpublished) release, `false` to create a published one.

parameters.name: auto_generate_release_notes
parameters.description: Automatically generate the name and body for the release. If 'name' is provided, it is used; otherwise, a name is auto-generated. 'Body' is prepended to generated notes if specified.

value_schema.description: Whether to automatically generate the name and body for this release. If `name` is specified, the specified name will be used; otherwise, a name will be automatically generated. If `body` is specified, the body will be pre-pended to the automatically generated notes.

parameters.name: mark_as_prerelease
parameters.description: Set to `true` for a prerelease, `false` for a full release.

value_schema.description: `true` to identify the release as a prerelease. `false` to identify the release as a full release.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Text describing the contents of the tag.

value_schema.description: Text describing the contents of the tag.

parameters.name: draft
parameters.description: `true` to create a draft (unpublished) release, `false` to create a published one.

value_schema.description: `true` to create a draft (unpublished) release, `false` to create a published one.

parameters.name: generate_release_notes
parameters.description: Whether to automatically generate the name and body for this release. If `name` is specified, the specified name will be used; otherwise, a name will be automatically generated. If `body` is specified, the body will be pre-pended to the automatically generated notes.

value_schema.description: Whether to automatically generate the name and body for this release. If `name` is specified, the specified name will be used; otherwise, a name will be automatically generated. If `body` is specified, the body will be pre-pended to the automatically generated notes.

parameters.name: make_latest
parameters.description: Specifies whether this release should be set as the latest release for the repository. Drafts and prereleases cannot be set as latest. Defaults to `true` for newly published releases. `legacy` specifies that the latest release should be determined based on the release creation date and higher semantic version.

value_schema.description: Specifies whether this release should be set as the latest release for the repository. Drafts and prereleases cannot be set as latest. Defaults to `true` for newly published releases. `legacy` specifies that the latest release should be determined based on the release creation date and higher semantic version.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the release.

value_schema.description: The name of the release.

parameters.name: prerelease
parameters.description: `true` to identify the release as a prerelease. `false` to identify the release as a full release.

value_schema.description: `true` to identify the release as a prerelease. `false` to identify the release as a full release.

parameters.name: tag_name
parameters.description: The name of the tag.

value_schema.description: The name of the tag.

parameters.name: target_commitish
parameters.description: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Can be any branch or commit SHA. Unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: the repository's default branch (usually `master`).

value_schema.description: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Can be any branch or commit SHA. Unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: the repository's default branch (usually `master`).

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
